title.narrative: KNOWLEDGE GENERATION ON CHILDREN &WOMEN

description.narrative: Key policy research and monitoring institutions, as well as central, regional and local government entities, effectively manage data related to children and women and periodically report on the situation of marginalised children and families, implementation of child-related legislation and international conventions., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 1 - GOVERNANCE FOR CHILDREN Effective public oversight and monitoring of institutions help to ensure implementation of policies and programmes addressing the needs and rights of marginalized children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Key policy research and monitoring institutions, as well as central, regional and local government entities, effectively managedata related to children and women and periodically report on the situation of marginalised children and families, implementationof child-related legislation and international conventions.

description.narrative: During 2016, UNICEF continued to support its government and civil society partners in strengthening Albania&39;s mechanisms for child rights data collection and reporting, prioritizing the requirements of data disaggregation to capture equity gaps, decentralized data collection and regularity of reporting. | Status:Met | As-of Date:25/12/2016

title.narrative: of planning and reporting documents (of national or local status) based on objective data on child wellbeing

target.value: 2014:All 12 Regions of Albania will have a system of planning/monitoring/reporting on child wellbeing

actual.value: 2016:At least 12 (all UNICEF-led or -supported, see the narrative statement)

title.narrative: % of regions with functional institutions to collect and publish sufficiently disaggregated data on child wellbeing to monitor child rights (as per harmonized list of child welfare indicators agreed with INSTAT)
regularity is established in reporting on the implementation of the CRC Concluding Observations (annually or as appropriate)

actual.value: 2016:The regularity in reporting has been maintained for 2016.

title.narrative: of significant reports by the State Agency for Child Rights Protection on the situation of vulnerable children
% of nationally established child wellbeing indicators actually collected

baseline.value: between 40% and 50% of the total number of indicators in the nationally established list
